escjava.plugin
Interface IEscjavaListener

All Known Implementing Classes:
EscjavaMarker
public interface IEscjavaListener

This interface represents listeners. These listeners want to know about one event: an error report from EscJava, via the method escjavaFailed.

Author:
David R. Cok

          A severity constant indicating an illegal condition.

Method Detail

escjavaFailed

void escjavaFailed(org.eclipse.core.resources.IResource resource,
                   java.lang.String file,
                   int lineNumber,
                   int offset,
                   int length,
                   java.lang.String errorMessage,
                   int severity)
This method represents the event in which there was an error during Escjava checking.

Parameters:
resource - The resource in which the error occured
file - The file in which the error occured
lineNumber - The line number where the error happened
offset - The character position (0-based) from the beginning of the file where the error begins
length - The number of characters to highlight
errorMessage - A message explaining the type of error
severity - The severity of the error (using one of the error severity constants defined in this class)
